Posts.Content:
Hello, everyone. I have this lump on my right breast. I had the mammogram and ultrasound and my doctor said that there's a very low chance that it's malignant. He didn't think biopsy is need. It hurts sometimes especially when I'm lying down. I'm deciding to have it removed nonetheless.
My concerns are after the surgery are 1. I work in a lab and have to lift boxes and grind hard samples constantly. How able would I be when I go back to work after the surgery? 2. What does the breast usually look like after the surgery? Will my breast tissues eventually fill out the space where the lump use to be? How does it feel after the surgery?
I appreciate any input. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Breast lump

Posts.Content: Thank you barkyboys. I really appreciate your reply.
Posts.Title: Breast lump

Posts.Content: Thank you POSTAL2. I truly appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy

Posts.Content:
Hello everyone. I just had the lump in my right breast removed two days ago. The lump was about
 half an inch. I'm in a little bit pain but I'm alright. I'm just waiting for the pathology result next week. Please pray for me. Thank you.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy

Posts.Content: The biopsy result came out benign. Whew! Thank God. Thank you for your support.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy

Posts.Content:
I just saw the wound today. It is still very fresh. I'm supposed to go back to work tomorrow but I don't think I should. My right chest still hurts when I move around. My post-op is on Friday. 
Postal2, barkyboys, and everyone else... thank you for your prayers and support.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy
